overview: The stylesheet defines a design system for a healthcare digital experience, including CSS resets, design tokens, typography, layout utilities, accessibility helpers, and theme variables for light and dark modes. It establishes consistent spacing, color, and typography scales for frontend components.
interactions: Focus state for skip links reveals accessibility navigation
Responsive typography scaling via media queries
routes: No explicit frontend routes defined; styles apply globally across all pages
data_flow: CSS variables cascade from :root and [data-theme='dark'] to components
Media queries modify font sizes and spacing based on viewport width
Focus states trigger visual transitions for accessibility elements
accessibility: Visually hidden utility for screen-reader-only content
Skip link focus behavior for keyboard navigation
High contrast focus outlines using --color-focus and --color-focus-ring
analytics: No direct analytics hooks in CSS; potential integration points via skip-link usage or theme toggling events
test_ideas: Verify skip-link visibility and focus behavior using keyboard navigation
Validate dark theme variable overrides for color contrast compliance
Check responsive typography scaling at defined breakpoints (768px, 1024px)
Ensure container width and padding adjust correctly across viewport sizes
Confirm visually-hidden elements are not visible but accessible to screen readers
Test CSS variable inheritance and fallback behavior when theme changes
